Well we'd have to think about whether we wanted to officially support  
two formats going forward.


I was a little disappointed when 2.0 dropped XML support for job, because I am running Heritrix via XML-RPC, and the order.xml can easily be sent as extra XML.

Still, I don't think there is much difference between the sheets and XML. It's the same data just structured out differently.
It's definitely a huge oversight that JMX can't do streaming  
operations -- the web UI can only edit 32K of seeds, for instance. I  
suppose we could try to extend JMX to allow streaming, but there's  
already a mountain of JMX support code in commons, and JMX is, alas,  
the standard.
That's why we have Telnet. Just log into the machine, and tail the logs.

The problem is that Heritrix is always switching log files when it starts a new job. It would be nice to direct all logging to common files. So that I could just tail one crawl.log file, and watch each job as it's processed.

Also, I would like to have the feature to truncate log files. Is this possible? I can do this with the Apache web server, tell it to limit the log file size to 200K.

Also for transferring large files like arcs or the crawl.log, you're  
better off using NFS/SMB. I wouldn't want to integrate a full WebDAV  
server (say) into Heritrix to enable arc removal; those kinds of  
tasks seem better suited to tools outside of Heritrix.

I don't think it should be Heritrix's job. It's a web crawler, and should focus on that area. Once you get into job management, fancy web interfaces, and enterprise services, then it's just less time spent improving the web crawler.

I like the daemon feeling that version 1.12 had, and I haven't had much time to play with 2.0 but I hope it still following that pattern.
